metadata.title: CVE-2019-19065 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** A memory leak in the sdma_init() function indrivers/infiniband/hw/hfi1/sdma.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.9 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggeringrhashtable_init() failures, aka CID-34b3be18a04e. NOTE: This has beendisputed as not a vulnerability because "rhashtable_init() can only fail ifit is passed invalid values in the second parameter's struct, but wheninvoked from sdma_init() that is a pointer to a static const struct, so anattacker could only trigger failure if they could corrupt kernel memory (inwhich case a small memory leak is not a significant problem)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-72-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-72-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-72-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-72-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1056-aws - 4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1064-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-gcp - 4.15.0-1050.53
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-oracle - 4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
